intro: Ramosia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a significant species in Philippine biodiversity.
